author: Special Correspondent
text:
Members of the Joint Action Council of Tamil Nadu Teachers’ Organisations staging a protest in Tiruchi on Monday.— Photo: A.Muralitharan

A total of 1250 members of the Joint Action Council of Tamil Nadu Teachers’ Organisations (JACTTO) including 750 women courted arrest here on Monday.

Though they were staging similar protest for the last three days, Monday’s protest saw higher turnout.

They were arrested when they attempted to stage a road roko on Collector’s office road. They raised slogans demanding the State government to accept their 15-point charter of demands. Salary on a par with the Union government teachers, addressing Sixth Pay Commission discrimination, implementation of Tamil-medium education from primary to secondary education in all schools in the State, scrapping teacher eligibility test, and appointing teachers based on seniority were among the demands. The protestors were released in the evening.

The functioning of schools in the district was affected due to the participation of many teachers in the strike. Though the schools functioned as usual, the attendance of teachers was reportedly thin in many schools, affecting the classes.
title: Teachers court arrest
